TERRORISM RISK INSURANCE The Terrorism Risk Insurance Program Reauthorization Act (TRIPRA)
TERRORISM RISK INSURANCE
The Terrorism Risk Insurance Program Reauthorization Act (TRIPRA)

• The September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks created a severe market
• The September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks created a severe market

shortage for terrorism insurance
shortage for terrorism insurance

• The US Congress passed the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act (TRIA) as a federal “backstop” for insurance claims related to terrorism events in the US and US interests abroad – It has been extended (with amendments) twice and the current Act is
• The US Congress passed the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act (TRIA) as a
federal “backstop” for insurance claims related to terrorism events in the
US and US interests abroad
– It has been extended (with amendments) twice and the current Act is

scheduled to expire on December 31, 2014, if not renewed
scheduled to expire on December 31, 2014, if not renewed

How The Act Works 2007 Renewal (Current In-Force)
How The Act Works
2007 Renewal (Current In-Force)

−For certified acts up to and including $27.5B, Treasury is “required to recoup 133% of the government coverage…through surcharges on property/casualty insurance policies” by Sep. 30, 2017
−For certified acts up to and
including $27.5B, Treasury is
“required to recoup 133% of the
government coverage…through
surcharges on property/casualty
insurance policies” by Sep. 30,
2017

−If the industry loss exceeds $27.5B, Treasury has discretionary authority to apply recoupment charges
−If the industry loss exceeds
$27.5B, Treasury has
discretionary authority to apply
recoupment charges

−Surcharge to policy not to exceed 3% of policy premium

exceed 3% of policy premium

TRIPRA and Workers’ Compensation
TRIPRA and Workers’ Compensation

• Terrorism exposure presents a unique challenge for workers’
• Terrorism exposure presents a unique challenge for workers’

– Workers’ compensation coverage is compulsory – employers are
– Workers’ compensation coverage is compulsory – employers are

required to provide it to employees
required to provide it to employees

– Individual states regulate the line of business – Statutory / unlimited requirements for workers’ compensation loss – No option to exclude or sublimit any form of terrorism loss (i.e.
– Individual states regulate the line of business
– Statutory / unlimited requirements for workers’ compensation loss
– No option to exclude or sublimit any form of terrorism loss (i.e.

conventional or NBCR)
conventional or NBCR)

• TRIPRA does not distinguish between attack modes
• TRIPRA does not distinguish between attack modes

• Coverage follows that afforded in the primary policy
• Coverage follows that afforded in the primary policy

• Annual policies with expiration dates on or after 1/1/2015 may be
• Annual policies with expiration dates on or after 1/1/2015 may be

Small v. Large Carrier Concerns
Small v. Large Carrier Concerns

• 2012 industry surplus for insurance companies writing TRIPRA exposed business is $589B
• 2012 industry surplus for insurance companies writing TRIPRA exposed business is $589B

• Approximately 850+ carriers subject to program
• Approximately 850+ carriers subject to program

• A higher percentage of the surplus for smaller insurers is required to meet the deductible requirements of TRIPRA. Consequently, smaller insurers tend to incorporate TRIPRA recoveries into their risk management strategies
• A higher percentage of the surplus for smaller insurers is required to meet the deductible
requirements of TRIPRA. Consequently, smaller insurers tend to incorporate TRIPRA
recoveries into their risk management strategies

• Larger insurers with TRIPRA deductibles in the billions of dollars tend to manage their
• Larger insurers with TRIPRA deductibles in the billions of dollars tend to manage their

exposures to specific zone accumulations rather than incorporating TRIPRA recoveries
exposures to specific zone accumulations rather than incorporating TRIPRA recoveries

• Rating agencies are focusing on risk accumulation / aggregation profiles and are asking
• Rating agencies are focusing on risk accumulation / aggregation profiles and are asking

insurers for specific strategies if TRIPRA expires without a replacement
insurers for specific strategies if TRIPRA expires without a replacement

• Reinsurers are able to provide more coverage for conventional weapons attacks than for
• Reinsurers are able to provide more coverage for conventional weapons attacks than for

Notes: 1. 2013 dollars based on Bureau of Labor statistics CPI Index 2. The loss figures above assume a 100% Property take-up rate among
Notes:
1. 2013 dollars based on Bureau of Labor statistics CPI Index
2. The loss figures above assume a 100% Property take-up rate among

3. Industry capital figures presented assume 100% of capital is available, or deployed, to cover terrorism. In reality, many (re)insurers – particularly capital/convergence markets – have little-to-no appetite to write terrorism because of correlation with financial markets loss.
3. Industry capital figures presented assume 100% of capital is available, or
deployed, to cover terrorism. In reality, many (re)insurers – particularly
capital/convergence markets – have little-to-no appetite to write terrorism
because of correlation with financial markets loss.

Source: Guy Carpenter Business Intelligence
Source: Guy Carpenter Business Intelligence

Current Market Impacts
Current Market Impacts

• Estimate $750M to $2B of individual risk capacity
• Estimate $750M to $2B of individual risk capacity

– Less capacity available and more expensive for terror exposed central business
– Less capacity available and more expensive for terror exposed central business

• Uncertainty around TRIPRA’s future and the possibility of late extension is creating
• Uncertainty around TRIPRA’s future and the possibility of late extension is creating

capacity and pricing issues for insurance buyers – Large carriers have implemented “conditional TRIPRA endorsements” and pushing
capacity and pricing issues for insurance buyers
– Large carriers have implemented “conditional TRIPRA endorsements” and pushing

prices up on large accumulation risks
prices up on large accumulation risks

• Market impact is expected to worsen starting on January 1, 2014
• Market impact is expected to worsen starting on January 1, 2014

– Carrier withdrawal and / or short term policies issued – Especially on the workers’ compensation line of business
– Carrier withdrawal and / or short term policies issued
– Especially on the workers’ compensation line of business

• Absence of TRIPRA or a substantial change, will
• Absence of TRIPRA or a substantial change, will

– Increase cost to insurance buyers across many industries – Reduce availability of terrorism coverage in the private market – May cause some policyholders to go without insurance protection against terrorism
– Increase cost to insurance buyers across many industries
– Reduce availability of terrorism coverage in the private market
– May cause some policyholders to go without insurance protection against terrorism
